title.en: Biography of the Marquis of Huaiyin
title.raw: 《淮陰侯列傳》 Biography of the Marquis of Huaiyin

sentences.zh: 淮陰侯韓信者，淮陰人也。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Huaiyin Han Xin was a man of Huaiyin.

sentences.zh: 始為布衣時，貧無行，不得推擇為吏，又不能治生商賈，常從人寄食飲，人多厭之者，常數從其下鄉南昌亭長寄食，數月，亭長妻患之，乃晨炊蓐食。

translations.literal: When he first wore commoner's clothes, he was poor and without proper conduct, could not be recommended for official position, and could not manage a livelihood through business or trade; he constantly depended on others for food and drink, and many people disliked him; he often went to the Nanchang pavilion chief below his village to beg for food, and after several months, the pavilion chief's wife was annoyed by it, so she cooked early and ate in bed.

sentences.zh: 食時信往，不為具食。

translations.literal: When mealtime came, Xin went there, but she did not prepare food for him.

sentences.zh: 信亦知其意，怒，竟絕去。

translations.literal: Xin also understood her intention, became angry, and finally left forever.

The Marquis of Huaiyin Han Xin was a man of Huaiyin. When he first wore commoner's clothes, he was poor and without proper conduct, could not be recommended for official position, and could not manage a livelihood through business or trade; he constantly depended on others for food and drink, and many people disliked him; he often went to the Nanchang pavilion chief below his village to beg for food, and after several months, the pavilion chief's wife was annoyed by it, so she cooked early and ate in bed. When mealtime came, Xin went there, but she did not prepare food for him. Xin also understood her intention, became angry, and finally left forever.

sentences.zh: 信釣於城下，諸母漂，有一母見信饑，飯信，竟漂數十日。

translations.literal: Xin fished below the city walls, and there were washerwomen rinsing clothes; one washerwoman saw that Xin was hungry and fed him, and for dozens of days she continued rinsing clothes.

sentences.zh: 信喜，謂漂母曰：「吾必有以重報母。」

translations.literal: Xin xi, wei piao mother said: 'I must have with zhong bao mother.'
translations.idiomatic: Xin was pleased and said to the washerwoman: 'I will certainly richly repay you.'

sentences.zh: 母怒曰：「大丈夫不能自食，吾哀王孫而進食，豈望報乎！」

translations.literal: Mother nu said: 'Da zhang fu not able self shi, I ai wang sun yet jin shi, qi wang bao?'
translations.idiomatic: The washerwoman angrily said: 'A great man cannot feed himself, I pity the noble scion and give him food—how can I hope for repayment!'

translations.literal: Xin fished below the city walls, and there were washerwomen rinsing clothes; one washerwoman saw that Xin was hungry and fed him, and for dozens of days she continued rinsing clothes. Xin was pleased and said to the washerwoman: 'I will certainly richly repay you.' The washerwoman angrily said: 'A great man cannot feed himself, I pity the noble scion and give him food—how can I hope for repayment!'

sentences.zh: 淮陰屠中少年有侮信者，曰：「若雖長大，好帶刀劍，中情怯耳。」

translations.literal: Huai Yin tu zhong shao nian have wu Xin ones, said: 'If though zhang da, good dai dao jian, zhong qing que.'
translations.idiomatic: Among the young butchers of Huaiyin there was one who insulted Xin, saying: 'Though you are tall and big, you like to wear swords, but in your heart you're cowardly.'

sentences.zh: 眾辱之曰：「信能死，刺我；

translations.literal: Zhong ru it said: 'Xin able die, ci I;
translations.idiomatic: The crowd humiliated him: 'If Xin dares die, stab me;

sentences.zh: 不能死，出我袴下。」

translations.literal: Not able die, out I ku xia.'
translations.idiomatic: If he doesn't dare die, crawl out from between my legs.'

sentences.zh: 於是信孰視之，俛出袴下，蒲伏。

translations.literal: Then Xin stared at him intently, bent down and crawled out from between his legs, and lay prostrate.

sentences.zh: 一市人皆笑信，以為怯。

translations.literal: All the people in the market laughed at Xin, considering him cowardly.

Among the young butchers of Huaiyin there was one who insulted Xin, saying: 'Though you are tall and big, you like to wear swords, but in your heart you're cowardly.' The crowd humiliated him: 'If Xin dares die, stab me; If he doesn't dare die, crawl out from between my legs.' Then Xin stared at him intently, bent down and crawled out from between his legs, and lay prostrate. All the people in the market laughed at Xin, considering him cowardly.

sentences.zh: 及項梁渡淮，信杖劍從之，居戲下，無所知名。

translations.literal: When Xiang Liang crossed the Huai, Xin took up sword and staff to follow him, dwelt under Xi, and was not known anywhere.

sentences.zh: 項梁敗，又屬項羽，羽以為郎中。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang was defeated, and he again attached himself to Xiang Yu, who made him a palace attendant.

sentences.zh: 數以策干項羽，羽不用。

translations.literal: He repeatedly presented strategies to Xiang Yu, but Yu did not use them.

sentences.zh: 漢王之入蜀，信亡楚歸漢，未得知名，為連敖。

translations.literal: When the Han king entered Shu, Xin fled Chu to return to Han, had not yet gained fame, and became a lian'ao.

sentences.zh: 坐法當斬，其輩十三人皆已斬，次至信，信乃仰視，適見滕公，曰：「上不欲就天下乎？

translations.literal: Zuo fa dang zhan, its bei thirteen person all already zhan, next reach Xin, Xin then yang shi, shi see Teng gong, said: 'Shang not desire jiu tian xia?
translations.idiomatic: He was condemned by law to beheading; his group of thirteen men had all already been executed, and when it came to Xin's turn, Xin looked up and happened to see Teng Gong, saying: 'Does Your Majesty not desire to obtain the empire?

sentences.zh: 何為斬壯士！」

translations.literal: What become zhan zhuang shi!'
translations.idiomatic: Why execute a stalwart warrior!'

sentences.zh: 滕公奇其言，壯其貌，釋而不斬。

translations.literal: Teng Gong was amazed by his words, admired his appearance, released him and did not execute him.

sentences.zh: 與語，大說之。

translations.literal: He spoke with him and was greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 言於上，上拜以為治粟都尉，上未之奇也。

translations.literal: He spoke to the emperor, who appointed him as Colonel of Grain Regulation. The emperor did not yet consider him extraordinary.

When Xiang Liang crossed the Huai, Xin took up sword and staff to follow him, dwelt under Xi, and was not known anywhere. Xiang Liang was defeated, and he again attached himself to Xiang Yu, who made him a palace attendant. He repeatedly presented strategies to Xiang Yu, but Yu did not use them. When the Han king entered Shu, Xin fled Chu to return to Han, had not yet gained fame, and became a lian'ao. He was condemned by law to beheading; his group of thirteen men had all already been executed, and when it came to Xin's turn, Xin looked up and happened to see Teng Gong, saying: 'Does Your Majesty not desire to obtain the empire? Why execute a stalwart warrior!' Teng Gong was amazed by his words, admired his appearance, released him and did not execute him. He spoke with him and was greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 信數與蕭何語，何奇之。

translations.literal: Xin frequently spoke with Xiao He, who considered him extraordinary.

sentences.zh: 至南鄭，諸將行道亡者數十人，信度何等已數言上，上不我用，即亡。

translations.literal: Upon arriving at Nanzheng, dozens of generals fled along the way. Xin estimated that Xiao He and others had already spoken to the emperor several times. Since the emperor would not use him, he fled.

sentences.zh: 何聞信亡，不及以聞，自追之。

translations.literal: When Xiao He heard that Xin had fled, without having time to report it, he personally pursued him.

sentences.zh: 人有言上曰：「丞相何亡。」

translations.literal: Someone speak emperor say: Prime minister He flee.
translations.idiomatic: Someone told the emperor: 'Prime Minister Xiao He has fled.'

sentences.zh: 上大怒，如失左右手。

translations.literal: The emperor was greatly angered, as if he had lost his left and right hands.

sentences.zh: 居一二日，何來謁上，上且怒且喜，罵何曰：「若亡，何也？」

translations.literal: Stay one two days, He come audience emperor, emperor both angry both happy, curse He say: You flee, why?
translations.idiomatic: After staying one or two days, Xiao He came to audience the emperor. The emperor was both angry and happy, cursing Xiao He: 'You fled. Why?'

sentences.zh: 何曰：「臣不敢亡也，臣追亡者。」

translations.literal: He say: Minister not dare flee, minister pursue flee person.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'This minister did not dare to flee. This minister was pursuing a fugitive.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「若所追者誰何？」

translations.literal: Emperor say: You pursue person who?
translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: 'The person you were pursuing—who was it?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「韓信也。」

translations.literal: Say: Han Xin.
translations.idiomatic: 'Han Xin.'

sentences.zh: 上復罵曰：「諸將亡者以十數，公無所追；

translations.literal: Emperor again curse say: Various generals flee by ten count, duke nothing pursue;
translations.idiomatic: The emperor cursed again: 'Generals who fled numbered in the dozens, yet you pursued none of them.

sentences.zh: 追信，詐也。」

translations.literal: Pursuing Xin—that's just deception.'

sentences.zh: 何曰：「諸將易得耳。

translations.literal: He say: Various generals easy obtain.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'Other generals are easily obtained.

sentences.zh: 至如信者，國士無雙。

translations.literal: As for someone like Xin, he is a peerless warrior of the realm.

sentences.zh: 王必欲長王漢中，無所事信；

translations.literal: Wang must desire long wang Han Zhong, nothing use Xin;
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty wishes to remain king in Hanzhong forever, then Xin is of no use.

sentences.zh: 必欲爭天下，非信無所與計事者。

translations.literal: But if Your Majesty wishes to contend for the world, there is no one else with whom to plan affairs except Xin.

sentences.zh: 顧王策安所決耳。」

translations.literal: Consider wang plan where decide.'
translations.idiomatic: Consider carefully, Your Majesty, where your strategy will decide.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吾亦欲東耳，安能郁郁久居此乎？」

translations.literal: Wang say: I also desire east, how able depressed long reside this?
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'I also wish to go east. How can I remain depressed here for long?'

sentences.zh: 何曰：「王計必欲東，能用信，信即留；

translations.literal: He say: Wang plan must desire east, able use Xin, Xin then stay;
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'If Your Majesty's plan is certainly to go east, and you can use Xin, then Xin will stay.

sentences.zh: 不能用，信終亡耳。」

translations.literal: Not able use, Xin finally flee.'
translations.idiomatic: If you cannot use him, Xin will ultimately flee.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吾為公以為將。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'I for gong with wei jiang.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'I will make you a general for your sake.'

sentences.zh: 何曰：「雖為將，信必不留。」

translations.literal: He said: 'Though become jiang, Xin must not stay.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'Even if made a general, Xin will certainly not stay.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「以為大將。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'With wei da jiang.'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'Then make him Grand General.'

sentences.zh: 何曰：「幸甚。」

translations.literal: He said: 'Xing very.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'That would be most fortunate.'

sentences.zh: 於是王欲召信拜之。

translations.literal: Then the king wished to summon Xin and enfeoff him.

sentences.zh: 何曰：「王素慢無禮，今拜大將如呼小兒耳，此乃信所以去也。

translations.literal: He said: 'Wang su man no li, now bai da jiang like hu little er, this then Xin so with go.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'Your Majesty has always been casual and discourteous; now enfeoffing the Grand General is like calling a child—this is why Xin would leave.

sentences.zh: 王必欲拜之，擇良日，齋戒，設壇場，具禮，乃可耳。」

translations.literal: Wang must desire bai it, ze liang ri, zhai jie, she tan chang, ju li, then able.'
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty must enfeoff him, choose an auspicious day, fast and purify, set up an altar and field, prepare the rites, then it will be acceptable.'

sentences.zh: 王許之。

translations.literal: The king agreed.

sentences.zh: 諸將皆喜，人人各自以為得大將。

translations.literal: All the generals were pleased, each thinking he himself would get the Grand General position.

sentences.zh: 至拜大將，乃韓信也，一軍皆驚。

translations.literal: When it came to enfeoffing the Grand General, it was Han Xin—the entire army was astonished.

The king said: 'I will make you a general for your sake.' Xiao He said: 'Even if made a general, Xin will certainly not stay.' The king said: 'Then make him Grand General.' Xiao He said: 'That would be most fortunate.' Then the king wished to summon Xin and enfeoff him. Xiao He said: 'Your Majesty has always been casual and discourteous; now enfeoffing the Grand General is like calling a child—this is why Xin would leave. If Your Majesty must enfeoff him, choose an auspicious day, fast and purify, set up an altar and field, prepare the rites, then it will be acceptable.' The king agreed. All the generals were pleased, each thinking he himself would get the Grand General position. When it came to enfeoffing the Grand General, it was Han Xin—the entire army was astonished.

sentences.zh: 信拜禮畢，上坐。

translations.literal: Xin completed the enfeoffment rites and sat above.

sentences.zh: 王曰：「丞相數言將軍，將軍何以教寡人計策？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Cheng xiang number yan jiang jun, jiang jun what with jiao gua person ji ce?'
translations.idiomatic: The king said: 'The Chancellor has repeatedly spoken of the General; General, what strategy will you teach me?'

sentences.zh: 信謝，因問王曰：「今東鄉爭權天下，豈非項王邪？」

translations.literal: Xin xie, because wen wang said: 'Now dong xiang zheng quan tian xia, qi not Xiang wang?'
translations.idiomatic: Xin thanked him, then asked the king: 'Now facing east to contend for power over the empire—is it not King Xiang?'

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「然。」

translations.literal: Han wang said: 'Ran.'
translations.idiomatic: The Han king said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「大王自料勇悍仁彊孰與項王？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Da wang self liao yong han ren qiang shu with Xiang wang?'
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'Your Majesty, appraise yourself: in courage, ferocity, benevolence, and strength, who compares with King Xiang?'

sentences.zh: 漢王默然良久，曰：「不如也。」

translations.literal: Han wang mo ran liang jiu, said: 'Not if.'
translations.idiomatic: The Han king was silent for a long time, then said: 'I am not his equal.'

sentences.zh: 信再拜賀曰：「惟信亦為大王不如也。

translations.literal: Xin again bai he said: 'Wei Xin also wei da wang not if.'
translations.idiomatic: Xin bowed twice in congratulations: 'Only I also consider Your Majesty not his equal.

sentences.zh: 然臣嘗事之，請言項王之為人也。

translations.literal: Yet I have served him; allow me to speak of King Xiang's character.

sentences.zh: 項王喑噁叱，千人皆廢，然不能任屬賢將，此特匹夫之勇耳。

translations.literal: King Xiang roars with rage and glares, a thousand men all collapse, yet he cannot appoint and employ worthy generals—this is merely the courage of a common man.

sentences.zh: 項王見人恭敬慈愛，言語嘔嘔，人有疾病，涕泣分食飲，至使人有功當封爵者，印刓敝，忍不能予，此所謂婦人之仁也。

translations.literal: King Xiang sees people with courtesy and kindness, speaks gently and tenderly; when people are ill, he weeps and shares his food and drink; but when it comes to those who have merit and should be enfeoffed with rank, the seals are worn and broken, he cannot bear to give them—this is what is called womanly benevolence.

sentences.zh: 項王雖霸天下而臣諸侯，不居關中而都彭城。

translations.literal: Although King Xiang hegemonized the world and made the feudal lords his subjects, he did not reside in Guanzhong but made Pengcheng his capital.

sentences.zh: 有背義帝之約，而以親愛王，諸侯不平。

translations.literal: He violated the agreement with the Righteous Emperor and instead enfeoffed his close relatives and favorites. The feudal lords were dissatisfied.

sentences.zh: 諸侯之見項王遷逐義帝置江南，亦皆歸逐其主而自王善地。

translations.literal: When the feudal lords saw King Xiang move and expel the Righteous Emperor to place him in Jiangnan, they also returned to expel their own lords and established themselves as kings in good territories.

sentences.zh: 項王所過無不殘滅者，天下多怨，百姓不親附，特劫於威彊耳。

translations.literal: Wherever King Xiang passed, he left nothing undestroyed. The world harbored much resentment. The common people did not closely attach themselves to him; they were merely coerced by his powerful might.

sentences.zh: 名雖為霸，實失天下心。

translations.literal: Although in name he was a hegemon, in reality he lost the hearts of the world.

sentences.zh: 故曰其彊易弱。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said that his strength easily became weakness.

sentences.zh: 今大王誠能反其道：任天下武勇，何所不誅！

translations.literal: Now great wang sincerely able reverse his way: Employ world martial brave, what place not execute!
translations.idiomatic: Now if Your Majesty can sincerely reverse his ways: Employ the world's martial and brave warriors—what place cannot be conquered!

sentences.zh: 以天下城邑封功臣，何所不服！

translations.literal: With world cities towns enfeoff merit ministers, what place not submit!
translations.idiomatic: Enfeoff meritorious ministers with the cities and towns of the world—what place will not submit!

sentences.zh: 以義兵從思東歸之士，何所不散！

translations.literal: With righteous troops follow think east return scholars, what place not disperse!
translations.idiomatic: With righteous troops following, and scholars thinking of returning east—what force will not disperse!

sentences.zh: 且三秦王為秦將，將秦子弟數歲矣，所殺亡不可勝計，又欺其眾降諸侯，至新安，項王詐阬秦降卒二十餘萬，唯獨邯、欣、翳得脫，秦父兄怨此三人，痛入骨髓。

translations.literal: Moreover, the three kings of Qin served as Qin generals and led Qin youths for several years. The number they killed and caused to perish cannot be counted. They also deceived their troops into surrendering to the feudal lords. At Xin'an, King Xiang deceitfully pit-killed over 200,000 Qin surrendering troops. Only Han, Xin, and Yi escaped alone. The Qin fathers and elder brothers resent these three men, their pain entering their very bone marrow.

sentences.zh: 今楚彊以威王此三人，秦民莫愛也。

translations.literal: Now Chu uses might to establish these three as kings. The Qin people love none of them.

sentences.zh: 大王之入武關，秋豪無所害，除秦苛法，與秦民約，法三章耳，秦民無不欲得大王王秦者。

translations.literal: When Your Majesty entered Wuguan, not even an autumn hair was harmed. You removed Qin's harsh laws and made an agreement with the Qin people—only three chapters of law. There is no Qin person who does not desire Your Majesty to be king of Qin.

sentences.zh: 於諸侯之約，大王當王關中，關中民咸知之。

translations.literal: According to the agreement among the feudal lords, Your Majesty should be king of Guanzhong. All the people of Guanzhong know this.

sentences.zh: 大王失職入漢中，秦民無不恨者。

translations.literal: Your Majesty lost your rightful position and entered Hanzhong. There is no Qin person who does not resent this.

sentences.zh: 今大王舉而東，三秦可傳檄而定也。」

translations.literal: Now great wang raise east, three Qin can transmit manifesto settle.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if Your Majesty raises troops and goes east, the three Qin regions can be settled by transmitting a manifesto.'

sentences.zh: 於是漢王大喜，自以為得信晚。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Han king was greatly pleased, considering that he had obtained Xin too late.

sentences.zh: 遂聽信計，部署諸將所擊。

translations.literal: He then followed Xin's plan and deployed the various generals to their attack positions.

Xin completed the enfeoffment rites and sat above. The king said: 'The Chancellor has repeatedly spoken of the General; General, what strategy will you teach me?' Xin thanked him, then asked the king: 'Now facing east to contend for power over the empire—is it not King Xiang?' The Han king said: 'Yes.' Xin said: 'Your Majesty, appraise yourself: in courage, ferocity, benevolence, and strength, who compares with King Xiang?' The Han king was silent for a long time, then said: 'I am not his equal.' Xin bowed twice in congratulations: 'Only I also consider Your Majesty not his equal. Yet I have served him; allow me to speak of King Xiang's character. King Xiang roars with rage and glares, a thousand men all collapse, yet he cannot appoint and employ worthy generals—this is merely the courage of a common man. King Xiang sees people with courtesy and kindness, speaks gently and tenderly; when people are ill, he weeps and shares his food and drink; but when it comes to those who have merit and should be enfeoffed with rank, the seals are worn and broken, he cannot bear to give them—this is what is called womanly benevolence.

sentences.zh: 八月，漢王舉兵東出陳倉，定三秦。

translations.literal: In the eighth month, the Han king raised troops and went east from Chencang, pacifying the three Qin regions.

sentences.zh: 漢二年，出關，收魏、河南，韓、殷王皆降。

translations.literal: In the second year of Han, he exited the pass and gathered Wei and Henan. The kings of Han and Yin all surrendered.

sentences.zh: 合齊、趙共擊楚。

translations.literal: He combined with Qi and Zhao to attack Chu together.

sentences.zh: 四月，至彭城，漢兵敗散而還。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, they reached Pengcheng. The Han troops were defeated and scattered, returning home.

sentences.zh: 信復收兵與漢王會滎陽，復擊破楚京、索之閒，以故楚兵卒不能西。

translations.literal: Xin again gathered troops and met the Han king at Xingyang. He again attacked and defeated Chu between Jing and Suo. Because of this, Chu troops ultimately could not advance west.

sentences.zh: 漢之敗卻彭城，塞王欣、翟王翳亡漢降楚，齊、趙亦反漢與楚和。

translations.literal: After Han's defeat and retreat from Pengcheng, King Sai Xin and King Dai Yi fled Han and surrendered to Chu. Qi and Zhao also rebelled against Han and allied with Chu.

sentences.zh: 六月，魏王豹謁歸視親疾，至國，即絕河關反漢，與楚約和。

translations.literal: In the sixth month, King Wei Bao took leave to return and see his relative's illness. Upon arriving in his state, he immediately cut off the river passes and rebelled against Han, making an alliance agreement with Chu.

sentences.zh: 漢王使酈生說豹，不下。

translations.literal: The Han king sent Li Sheng to persuade Bao, but he did not submit.

sentences.zh: 其八月，以信為左丞相，擊魏。

translations.literal: In that eighth month, Xin was appointed Left Prime Minister and attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏王盛兵蒲阪，塞臨晉，信乃益為疑兵，陳船欲度臨晉，而伏兵從夏陽以木罌缻渡軍，襲安邑。

translations.literal: The King of Wei amassed troops at Puban and blocked Linjin. Xin then created additional feigned troops, arraying ships as if he wished to cross at Linjin, while his ambush troops crossed the army from Xiayang using wooden jars and pots, attacking Anyi by surprise.

sentences.zh: 魏王豹驚，引兵迎信，信遂虜豹，定魏為河東郡。

translations.literal: King Wei Bao was alarmed and led troops to meet Xin. Xin then captured Bao and pacified Wei, establishing it as Hedong commandery.

sentences.zh: 漢王遣張耳與信俱，引兵東，北擊趙、代。

translations.literal: The Han king sent Zhang Er together with Xin. They led troops east and north to attack Zhao and Dai.

sentences.zh: 後九月，破代兵，禽夏說閼與。

translations.literal: In the following ninth month, he defeated Dai's troops and captured Xia Yue Yanyu.

sentences.zh: 信之下魏破代，漢輒使人收其精兵，詣滎陽以距楚。

translations.literal: After Xin subdued Wei and defeated Dai, Han repeatedly sent people to gather his elite troops and send them to Xingyang to resist Chu.

sentences.zh: 信與張耳以兵數萬，欲東下井陘擊趙。

translations.literal: Xin together with Zhang Er, with tens of thousands of troops, wished to go east down through Jingxing to attack Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙王、成安君陳餘聞漢且襲之也，聚兵井陘口，號稱二十萬。

translations.literal: The King of Zhao and Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu heard that Han was about to attack them. They gathered troops at the mouth of Jingxing, claiming twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 廣武君李左車說成安君曰：「聞漢將韓信涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，新喋血閼與，今乃輔以張耳，議欲下趙，此乘勝而去國遠鬬，其鋒不可當。

translations.literal: Guang Wu jun Li Zuo Che persuade Cheng An jun say: Hear Han general Han Xin ford Xi He, capture Wei wang, catch Xia Yue, recently blood flow Yan Yu, now moreover assist with Zhang Er, discuss wish descend Zhao, this ride victory leave country far fight, his point not able resist.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Guangwu Li Zuoche persuaded Lord Cheng'an, saying: 'I hear that the Han general Han Xin forded the Xi River, captured the King of Wei, caught Xia Yue, and recently blood flowed at Yanyu. Now he is assisted by Zhang Er and plans to descend upon Zhao. This is riding victory to leave their country and fight far away—their momentum cannot be resisted.

sentences.zh: 臣聞千里餽糧，士有饑色，樵蘇後爨，師不宿飽。

translations.literal: This minister has heard that when grain is sent from a thousand li away, the soldiers have hungry faces. When firewood is gathered after cooking, the army is not sated overnight.

sentences.zh: 今井陘之道，車不得方軌，騎不得成列，行數百里，其勢糧食必在其後。

translations.literal: Now the Jingxing road is such that chariots cannot travel abreast and cavalry cannot form ranks. Marching several hundred li, their supplies must necessarily come after them.

sentences.zh: 願足下假臣奇兵三萬人，從閒道絕其輜重；

translations.literal: Wish your subordinate lend minister surprise troops three ten thousand people, from secluded path cut off their baggage train;
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Lordship would lend me thirty thousand surprise troops to cut off their baggage train by a secluded path.

sentences.zh: 足下深溝高壘，堅營勿與戰。

translations.literal: Your Lordship should dig deep moats and build high ramparts, fortify the camp and not engage in battle.

sentences.zh: 彼前不得鬬，退不得還，吾奇兵絕其後，使野無所掠，不至十日，而兩將之頭可致於戲下。

translations.literal: They cannot advance to fight nor retreat to return. My surprise troops will cut off their rear, leaving the fields with nothing to plunder. In not more than ten days, the heads of those two generals can be delivered beneath your tent.

sentences.zh: 願君留意臣之計。

translations.literal: I wish my lord would give heed to this minister's plan.

sentences.zh: 否，必為二子所禽矣。」

translations.literal: No, must for two sons captured.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, you will certainly be captured by those two men.'

sentences.zh: 成安君，儒者也，常稱義兵不用詐謀奇計，曰：「吾聞兵法十則圍之，倍則戰。

translations.literal: Cheng An jun, Confucian, often say righteous troops not use deceit stratagems surprise plans, say: I hear military method ten then surround them, double then battle.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Cheng'an was a Confucian who often said that righteous troops do not use deceitful stratagems or surprise plans. He said: 'I have heard that according to military strategy, if you have ten times their number then surround them; if you have double then fight.

sentences.zh: 今韓信兵號數萬，其實不過數千。

translations.literal: Now Han Xin's troops are claimed to be tens of thousands, but in reality they do not exceed several thousand.

sentences.zh: 能千里而襲我，亦已罷極。

translations.literal: Able to attack us from a thousand li away, they are already exhausted to the extreme.

sentences.zh: 今如此避而不擊，後有大者，何以加之！

translations.literal: Now like this avoid not strike, later have bigger, what with add it!
translations.idiomatic: Now to avoid fighting them like this—if there is someone bigger later, what can be added to this!

sentences.zh: 則諸侯謂吾怯，而輕來伐我。」

translations.literal: Then various marquises call me cowardly, lightly come attack me.'
translations.idiomatic: Then the feudal lords will call me cowardly and lightly come to attack me.'

sentences.zh: 不聽廣武君策，廣武君策不用。

translations.literal: He did not listen to Lord Guangwu's plan. Lord Guangwu's plan was not used.

sentences.zh: 韓信使人閒視，知其不用，還報，則大喜，乃敢引兵遂下。

translations.literal: Han Xin sent people to secretly observe and learned that they were not using Li Zuoche's plan. He returned and reported this, then was greatly pleased, and dared to lead his troops down.

sentences.zh: 未至井陘口三十里，止舍。

translations.literal: Thirty li before reaching the mouth of Jingxing, he stopped and lodged.

sentences.zh: 夜半傳發，選輕騎二千人，人持一赤幟，從閒道萆山而望趙軍，誡曰：「趙見我走，必空壁逐我，若疾入趙壁，拔趙幟，立漢赤幟。」

translations.literal: Night half transmit dispatch, select light cavalry two thousand people, each hold one red banner, from secluded path ascend mountain gaze Zhao army, warn say: Zhao see me flee, must empty rampart pursue me, if quickly enter Zhao rampart, pull Zhao banner, establish Han red banner.
translations.idiomatic: At midnight he transmitted orders and selected two thousand light cavalry, each holding a red banner. From a secluded path they ascended the mountain to watch the Zhao army. He warned them: 'When Zhao sees us flee, they will surely empty their fortifications to pursue us. If you quickly enter Zhao's fortifications, pull down their banners and establish Han's red banners.'

sentences.zh: 令其裨將傳飱，曰：「今日破趙會食！」

translations.literal: Order his deputy general transmit meal, say: Today break Zhao assembly eat!
translations.idiomatic: He ordered his deputy general to transmit meals, saying: 'Today we will break Zhao and assemble to eat!'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆莫信，詳應曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Various generals all not believe, pretend respond say: Yes.
translations.idiomatic: All the generals did not believe him, but pretended to respond: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 謂軍吏曰：「趙已先據便地為壁，且彼未見吾大將旗鼓，未肯擊前行，恐吾至阻險而還。」

translations.literal: Tell army officials say: Zhao already first occupy convenient land as rampart, moreover they not see my great general banner drum, not willing strike forward row, fear I arrive blocked dangerous return.
translations.idiomatic: He told the army officials: 'Zhao has already occupied the convenient terrain to form fortifications. Moreover, they have not seen my great general's banners and drums, so they are unwilling to attack the forward ranks, fearing that I will reach dangerous terrain and return.'

sentences.zh: 信乃使萬人先行，出，背水陳。

translations.literal: Xin then had ten thousand men go first, exiting to form a battle line with their backs to the water.

sentences.zh: 趙軍望見而大笑。

translations.literal: The Zhao army saw this and laughed greatly.

sentences.zh: 平旦，信建大將之旗鼓，鼓行出井陘口，趙開壁擊之，大戰良久。

translations.literal: At dawn, Xin erected the great general's banners and drums, marched with drumming out of the Jingxing mouth. Zhao opened their fortifications to attack them, and there was a great battle for a long time.

sentences.zh: 於是信、張耳詳棄鼓旗，走水上軍。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xin and Zhang Er pretended to abandon their drums and banners, fleeing to the army above the water.

sentences.zh: 水上軍開入之，復疾戰。

translations.literal: The army above the water opened to admit them, and again fought fiercely.

sentences.zh: 趙果空壁爭漢鼓旗，逐韓信、張耳。

translations.literal: Zhao indeed emptied their fortifications to contend for Han's drums and banners, pursuing Han Xin and Zhang Er.

sentences.zh: 韓信、張耳已入水上軍，軍皆殊死戰，不可敗。

translations.literal: Han Xin and Zhang Er had already entered the army above the water. The army all fought desperately and could not be defeated.

sentences.zh: 信所出奇兵二千騎，共候趙空壁逐利，則馳入趙壁，皆拔趙旗，立漢赤幟二千。

translations.literal: Xin's surprise troops of two thousand cavalry waited together for Zhao to empty their fortifications and pursue the advantage, then galloped into Zhao's fortifications, pulled down all Zhao's banners, and established two thousand Han red banners.

sentences.zh: 趙軍已不勝，不能得信等，欲還歸壁，壁皆漢赤幟，而大驚，以為漢皆已得趙王將矣，兵遂亂，遁走，趙將雖斬之，不能禁也。

translations.literal: The Zhao army could no longer prevail and could not capture Xin and the others. They wished to return to their fortifications, but saw that all the fortifications had Han red banners. They were greatly alarmed, thinking that Han had already captured all of Zhao's king and generals. The troops then became chaotic and fled. Even though Zhao's generals killed some of them, they could not stop it.

sentences.zh: 於是漢兵夾擊，大破虜趙軍，斬成安君泜水上，禽趙王歇。

translations.literal: Thereupon Han troops attacked from both flanks, greatly defeating and capturing the Zhao army. They beheaded Lord Cheng'an above the Chi River and captured King Xie of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 信乃令軍中毋殺廣武君，有能生得者購千金。

translations.literal: Xin then ordered the army not to kill Lord Guangwu, offering a thousand pieces of gold for anyone who could capture him alive.

sentences.zh: 於是有縛廣武君而致戲下者，信乃解其縛，東鄉坐，西鄉對，師事之。

translations.literal: Thereupon someone bound Lord Guangwu and delivered him beneath the tent. Xin then loosened his bonds, sat facing east, had him answer facing west, and served him as a teacher.

sentences.zh: 諸將效首虜，（休）畢賀，因問信曰：「兵法右倍山陵，前左水澤，今者將軍令臣等反背水陳，曰破趙會食，臣等不服。

translations.literal: Various generals present heads captives, finish congratulate, then ask Xin say: Military method right double mountain ridge, front left water marsh, now general command minister etc. instead back water battle formation, say break Zhao assembly eat, minister etc. not convinced.
translations.idiomatic: The various generals presented the heads and captives, finished congratulating him, and then asked Xin: 'Military strategy says to place mountains and hills on the right, water and marshes in front and left. Now the general commanded us to form a battle line with our backs to the water instead, saying we would break Zhao and assemble to eat. We ministers were not convinced.

sentences.zh: 然竟以勝，此何術也？」

translations.literal: However finally with win, this what method?
translations.idiomatic: However, we ultimately won. What method was this?'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「此在兵法，顧諸君不察耳。

translations.literal: Xin say: This in military method, consider various lords not examine.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'This is in the military methods, but you gentlemen did not examine it carefully.

sentences.zh: 兵法不曰『陷之死地而後生，置之亡地而後存』？

translations.literal: Military method not say trap them death land then live, place them perish land then survive?
translations.idiomatic: Doesn't military strategy say: 'Trap them in deadly terrain and they will live; place them in doomed terrain and they will survive'?

sentences.zh: 且信非得素拊循士大夫也，此所謂『驅市人而戰之』，其勢非置之死地，使人人自為戰；

translations.literal: Moreover Xin not obtain accustomed caress follow scholar officials, this called drive market people battle them, its situation not place death land, make each person self for battle;
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I did not obtain soldiers who were accustomed to following scholarly officials. This is what is called 'driving marketplace people to battle them.' The situation required placing them in deadly terrain so that each person would fight for himself.

sentences.zh: 今予之生地，皆走，寧尚可得而用之乎！」

translations.literal: Now give them living land, all flee, rather still able obtain use them!'
translations.idiomatic: If I had given them safe terrain now, they would all flee. How could I still obtain and use them!'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆服曰：「善。

translations.literal: Various generals all submit say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: All the generals submitted, saying: 'Good.

sentences.zh: 非臣所及也。」

translations.literal: Not minister reach.'
translations.idiomatic: This is beyond what ministers can reach.'

sentences.zh: 於是信問廣武君曰：「仆欲北攻燕，東伐齊，何若而有功？」

translations.literal: Thereupon Xin ask Guang Wu jun say: I wish north attack Yan, east attack Qi, how then have merit?
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xin asked Lord Guangwu: 'I wish to attack Yan to the north and Qi to the east. How can I achieve merit?'

sentences.zh: 廣武君辭謝曰：「臣聞敗軍之將，不可以言勇，亡國之大夫，不可以圖存。

translations.literal: Guang Wu jun decline thank say: Minister hear defeated army general, not can speak courage, perished state official, not can plan survive.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Guangwu declined and thanked him, saying: 'I have heard that a general who defeats armies cannot speak of courage; an official of a perished state cannot plan for survival.

sentences.zh: 今臣敗亡之虜，何足以權大事乎！」

translations.literal: Now minister defeated perished captive, what sufficient weigh great matters!'
translations.idiomatic: Now this minister is a captive from a defeated and perished state. How can I be sufficient to weigh great matters!'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「仆聞之，百里奚居虞而虞亡，在秦而秦霸，非愚於虞而智於秦也，用與不用，聽與不聽也。

translations.literal: Xin say: I hear, Bai Li Xi reside Yu Yu perish, in Qin Qin hegemon, not stupid Yu intelligent Qin, use not use, listen not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'I have heard that when Baili Xi resided in Yu, Yu perished; when he was in Qin, Qin became hegemon. It was not that he was stupid in Yu and intelligent in Qin—it was whether he was used or not, listened to or not.

sentences.zh: 誠令成安君聽足下計，若信者亦已為禽矣。

translations.literal: If Lord Cheng'an had sincerely listened to your plan, someone like Xin would also already have been captured.

sentences.zh: 以不用足下，故信得侍耳。」

translations.literal: Because not use you, therefore Xin obtain serve.'
translations.idiomatic: Because they did not use you, therefore Xin was able to serve.'

sentences.zh: 因固問曰：「仆委心歸計，願足下勿辭。」

translations.literal: Then firmly ask say: I entrust heart return plan, wish your honor not decline.
translations.idiomatic: He then firmly asked: 'I entrust my heart and return to your plans. I wish Your Honor not to decline.'

sentences.zh: 廣武君曰：「臣聞智者千慮，必有一失；

translations.literal: Guang Wu jun say: Minister hear wise person thousand considerations, must have one miss;
translations.idiomatic: Lord Guangwu said: 'I have heard that even the wise, after a thousand considerations, must have one mistake.

sentences.zh: 愚者千慮，必有一得。

translations.literal: Even fools, after a thousand considerations, must have one success.

sentences.zh: 故曰『狂夫之言，聖人擇焉』。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said: 'From the madman's words, the sage selects what is valuable.'

sentences.zh: 顧恐臣計未必足用，願效愚忠。

translations.literal: But I fear my plans may not be sufficient for use. I wish to offer my foolish loyalty.

sentences.zh: 夫成安君有百戰百勝之計，一旦而失之，軍敗鄗下，身死泜上。

translations.literal: Indeed, Lord Cheng'an had plans for a hundred battles and a hundred victories. In one morning he lost them all. His army was defeated below Hao, and he died above the Chi River.

sentences.zh: 今將軍涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說閼與，一舉而下井陘，不終朝破趙二十萬眾，誅成安君。

translations.literal: Now the general has forded the Xi River, captured the King of Wei, caught Xia Yue at Yanyu, in one campaign descended Jingxing, and before the morning was complete broke Zhao's twenty thousand multitude and executed Lord Cheng'an.

sentences.zh: 名聞海內，威震天下，農夫莫不輟耕釋耒，褕衣甘食，傾耳以待命者。

translations.literal: His name is heard within the four seas, his might shakes all under heaven. Farmers do not fail to stop plowing and release their plowshares, don fine clothes and eat sweet foods, inclining their ears to await his commands.

sentences.zh: 若此，將軍之所長也。

translations.literal: This is what the general is good at.

sentences.zh: 然而眾勞卒罷，其實難用。

translations.literal: However, the multitude is tired and the troops weary—their reality makes them difficult to use.

sentences.zh: 今將軍欲舉倦獘之兵，頓之燕堅城之下，欲戰恐久力不能拔，情見勢屈，曠日糧竭，而弱燕不服，齊必距境以自彊也。

translations.literal: Now if the general wishes to raise tired and exhausted troops and exhaust them beneath Yan's firm cities, desiring battle but fearing that prolonged effort cannot conquer them, his feelings will show and his situation will weaken, days will drag on and grain will be exhausted. The weak Yan will not submit, and Qi will certainly defend its borders to strengthen itself.

sentences.zh: 燕齊相持而不下，則劉項之權未有所分也。

translations.literal: If Yan and Qi hold each other without falling, then Liu and Xiang's authority will not have a place to divide.

sentences.zh: 若此者，將軍所短也。

translations.literal: This is what the general is not good at.

sentences.zh: 臣愚，竊以為亦過矣。

translations.literal: This foolish minister secretly thinks it would also be wrong.

sentences.zh: 故善用兵者不以短擊長，而以長擊短。」

translations.literal: Therefore good use troops not with short strike long, but with long strike short.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore those who are good at using troops do not use their weaknesses to strike strengths, but use their strengths to strike weaknesses.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「然則何由？」

translations.literal: Han Xin say: Then what by?
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'Then by what means?'

sentences.zh: 廣武君對曰：「方今為將軍計，莫如案甲休兵，鎮趙撫其孤，百里之內，牛酒日至，以饗士大夫醳兵，北首燕路，而後遣辯士奉咫尺之書，暴其所長於燕，燕必不敢不聽從。

translations.literal: Guang Wu jun answer say: Just now for general plan, nothing like press armor rest troops, pacify Zhao comfort its orphans, hundred li within, cow wine daily arrive, to feast scholar officials loosen troops, north face Yan road, then send eloquent scholars present foot inch letter, expose his strengths at Yan, Yan must not dare not listen follow.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Guangwu replied: 'For the general's plan right now, nothing is better than pressing down armor and resting troops, pacifying Zhao and comforting its orphans. Within a hundred li, let cow and wine arrive daily to feast the scholar-officials and loosen the troops. Face north toward Yan's road, then send eloquent scholars bearing foot-long letters, exposing his strengths to Yan. Yan will certainly dare not fail to listen and follow.

sentences.zh: 燕已從，使諠言者東告齊，齊必從風而服，雖有智者，亦不知為齊計矣。

translations.literal: Once Yan has followed, send rumor-spreaders east to tell Qi. Qi will certainly follow the wind and submit. Even if there are wise men, they will not know how to plan for Qi.

sentences.zh: 如是，則天下事皆可圖也。

translations.literal: In this way, all the affairs of the world can be planned.

sentences.zh: 兵固有先聲而後實者，此之謂也。」

translations.literal: Troops indeed have first reputation then substance, this call it.'
translations.idiomatic: Troops indeed have cases where reputation comes first and substance follows—this is what is called that.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Han Xin say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 從其策，發使使燕，燕從風而靡。

translations.literal: He followed his plan, dispatched envoys to Yan, and Yan followed the wind and fell prostrate.

sentences.zh: 乃遣使報漢，因請立張耳為趙王，以鎮撫其國。

translations.literal: Then he dispatched envoys to report to Han, and requested that Zhang Er be established as King of Zhao to pacify and comfort their state.

sentences.zh: 漢王許之，乃立張耳為趙王。

translations.literal: The Han king permitted it and established Zhang Er as King of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 楚數使奇兵渡河擊趙，趙王耳、韓信往來救趙，因行定趙城邑，發兵詣漢。

translations.literal: Chu repeatedly sent surprise troops across the river to attack Zhao. King Zhao Er and Han Xin went back and forth to save Zhao, and in the process settled Zhao's cities and towns, dispatching troops to go to Han.

sentences.zh: 楚方急圍漢王於滎陽，漢王南出，之宛、葉閒，得黥布，走入成皋，楚又復急圍之。

translations.literal: Chu was just urgently surrounding the Han king at Xingyang. The Han king exited south, went between Wan and Ye, obtained Qing Bu, fled into Chenggao, and Chu again urgently surrounded him.

sentences.zh: 六月，漢王出成皋，東渡河，獨與滕公俱，從張耳軍修武。

translations.literal: In the sixth month, the Han king exited Chenggao, crossed the river east, alone together with Duke Teng, and followed Zhang Er's army to Xiuwu.

sentences.zh: 至，宿傳舍。

translations.literal: Upon arrival, he lodged at the relay station.

sentences.zh: 晨自稱漢使，馳入趙壁。

translations.literal: In the morning he called himself a Han envoy and galloped into Zhao's fortifications.

sentences.zh: 張耳、韓信未起，即其臥內上奪其印符，以麾召諸將，易置之。

translations.literal: Zhang Er and Han Xin had not yet risen. Right in their sleeping quarters the emperor seized their seals and tallies, and with banners summoned the various generals, changing their positions.

sentences.zh: 信、耳起，乃知漢王來，大驚。

translations.literal: When Xin and Er rose, they then knew the Han king had come, and were greatly alarmed.

sentences.zh: 漢王奪兩人軍，即令張耳備守趙地。

translations.literal: The Han king seized the two men's army, then commanded Zhang Er to prepare to guard Zhao territory.

sentences.zh: 拜韓信為相國，收趙兵未發者擊齊。

translations.literal: He appointed Han Xin as prime minister and gathered Zhao troops that had not been dispatched to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 信引兵東，未渡平原，聞漢王使酈食其已說下齊，韓信欲止。

translations.literal: Xin led troops east, had not crossed Pingyuan, heard that the Han king had sent Li Shiqi who had already persuaded Qi to submit, and Han Xin wished to stop.

sentences.zh: 范陽辯士蒯通說信曰：「將軍受詔擊齊，而漢獨發閒使下齊，寧有詔止將軍乎？

translations.literal: Fan Yang eloquent scholar Kuai Tong persuade Xin say: General receive decree strike Qi, but Han alone dispatch secret envoy descend Qi, rather have decree stop general?
translations.idiomatic: The eloquent scholar Kuai Tong from Fanyang persuaded Xin, saying: 'The general received a decree to attack Qi, but Han alone dispatched a secret envoy to bring Qi down. Is there rather a decree to stop the general?

sentences.zh: 何以得毋行也！

translations.literal: What with obtain not go!
translations.idiomatic: How can you not proceed!

sentences.zh: 且酈生一士，伏軾掉三寸之舌，下齊七十餘城，將軍將數萬眾，歲餘乃下趙五十餘，為將數歲，反不如一豎儒之功乎？」

translations.literal: Moreover Li Sheng one scholar, bend chariot wag three inch tongue, descend Qi seventy remainder cities, general lead several ten thousand multitude, year remainder then descend Zhao fifty remainder, be general several years, instead not as one vertical Confucian merit?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Li Sheng is just one scholar who, bending over his chariot, wagged his three-inch tongue and brought down over seventy Qi cities. The general leads tens of thousands, took over a year to bring down over fifty Zhao cities, and has been a general for several years—does he instead not equal one lowly scholar's merit?'

sentences.zh: 於是信然之，從其計，遂渡河。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xin approved it, followed his plan, and crossed the river.

sentences.zh: 齊已聽酈生，即留縱酒，罷備漢守御。

translations.literal: Qi had already listened to Li Sheng, so they stayed and indulged in wine, dismissing preparations to defend against Han.

sentences.zh: 信因襲齊歷下軍，遂至臨菑。

translations.literal: Xin then attacked Qi's Lixia army and arrived at Linzi.

sentences.zh: 齊王田廣以酈生賣己，乃亨之，而走高密，使使之楚請救。

translations.literal: King Qi Tian Guang, thinking Li Sheng had betrayed him, cooked him, and fled to Gaomi, sending envoys to Chu to request rescue.

sentences.zh: 韓信已定臨菑，遂東追廣至高密西。

translations.literal: Han Xin had already settled Linzi, then pursued Guang east to west of Gaomi.

sentences.zh: 楚亦使龍且將，號稱二十萬，救齊。

translations.literal: Chu also sent Long Ju to lead, claiming twenty thousand, to save Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王廣、龍且并軍與信戰，未合。

translations.literal: King Qi Guang and Long Ju combined their armies to battle Xin, but had not yet engaged.

sentences.zh: 人或說龍且曰：「漢兵遠鬬窮戰，其鋒不可當。

translations.literal: Someone persuade Long Ju say: Han troops far fight exhausted battle, their point not able resist.
translations.idiomatic: Someone persuaded Long Ju, saying: 'Han troops fight far away and are exhausted in battle—their momentum cannot be resisted.

sentences.zh: 齊、楚自居其地戰，兵易敗散。

translations.literal: Qi and Chu fighting on their own territory, their troops easily become defeated and scattered.

sentences.zh: 不如深壁，令齊王使其信臣招所亡城，亡城聞其王在，楚來救，必反漢。

translations.literal: It would be better to build deep fortifications and command the King of Qi to have his trusted ministers summon the lost cities. The lost cities, hearing their king is present and Chu has come to save them, will certainly rebel against Han.

sentences.zh: 漢兵二千里客居，齊城皆反之，其勢無所得食，可無戰而降也。」

translations.literal: Han troops two thousand li guest reside, Qi cities all rebel them, their situation nothing obtain eat, can no battle surrender.'
translations.idiomatic: Han troops reside as guests two thousand li away. If all Qi cities rebel against them, they will have no way to obtain food. They can be made to surrender without battle.'

sentences.zh: 龍且曰：「吾平生知韓信為人，易與耳。

translations.literal: Long Ju say: I all life know Han Xin be person, easy deal.
translations.idiomatic: Long Ju said: 'I have known Han Xin all my life—he is easy to deal with.

sentences.zh: 且夫救齊不戰而降之，吾何功？

translations.literal: Moreover save Qi not battle surrender them, I what merit?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if I save Qi without battle and make them surrender, what merit do I have?

sentences.zh: 今戰而勝之，齊之半可得，何為止！」

translations.literal: Now battle win them, Qi half can obtain, why stop!'
translations.idiomatic: Now if I battle and defeat them, I can obtain half of Qi. Why stop!'

sentences.zh: 遂戰，與信夾濰水陳。

translations.literal: They then battled, forming battle lines flanking the Wei River with Xin.

sentences.zh: 韓信乃夜令人為萬餘囊，滿盛沙，壅水上流，引軍半渡，擊龍且，詳不勝，還走。

translations.literal: Han Xin then ordered people at night to make over ten thousand bags, filled them with sand, and blocked the upper stream of the water. He led half his army across, attacked Long Ju, pretended not to win, and retreated.

sentences.zh: 龍且果喜曰：「固知信怯也。」

translations.literal: Long Ju indeed happy say: Firmly know Xin cowardly.
translations.idiomatic: Long Ju was indeed pleased, saying: 'I knew Xin was cowardly.'

sentences.zh: 遂追信渡水。

translations.literal: He then pursued Xin across the water.

sentences.zh: 信使人決壅囊，水大至。

translations.literal: Xin had people break open the blocked bags, and great waters arrived.

sentences.zh: 龍且軍大半不得渡，即急擊，殺龍且。

translations.literal: More than half of Long Ju's army could not cross, so Xin urgently attacked and killed Long Ju.

sentences.zh: 龍且水東軍散走，齊王廣亡去。

translations.literal: Long Ju's army east of the water scattered in flight, and King Guang of Qi fled.

sentences.zh: 信遂追北至城陽，皆虜楚卒。

translations.literal: Xin then pursued north to Chengyang, capturing all the Chu troops.

sentences.zh: 漢四年，遂皆降平齊。

translations.literal: In the fourth year of Han, all then surrendered and Qi was pacified.

sentences.zh: 使人言漢王曰：「齊偽詐多變，反覆之國也，南邊楚，不為假王以鎮之，其勢不定。

translations.literal: Send people speak Han wang say: Qi false deceit many change, repeatedly country, south border Chu, not for temporary wang to pacify it, its situation not settled.
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to tell the Han king: 'Qi is a country of false deceit and many changes, a land of reversals. It borders Chu to the south. If you do not make me a temporary king to pacify it, the situation will not be settled.

sentences.zh: 願為假王便。」

translations.literal: Wish be temporary wang convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish to be temporary king for convenience.'

sentences.zh: 當是時，楚方急圍漢王於滎陽，韓信使者至，發書，漢王大怒，罵曰：「吾困於此，旦暮望若來佐我，乃欲自立為王！」

translations.literal: At this time, Chu just urgently surround Han wang at Xing Yang, Han Xin envoy arrive, open letter, Han wang greatly angry, curse say: I distressed at this, morning evening hope you come assist me, actually wish self establish as wang!
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chu was urgently surrounding the Han king at Xingyang. When Han Xin's envoy arrived and opened the letter, the Han king was greatly angered and cursed: 'I am distressed here, hoping morning and night that you would come assist me, yet you wish to establish yourself as king!'

sentences.zh: 張良、陳平躡漢王足，因附耳語曰：「漢方不利，寧能禁信之王乎？

translations.literal: Zhang Liang, Chen Ping step Han wang foot, then attach ear speak say: Han just unfavorable, rather able prohibit Xin wang?
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang and Chen Ping stepped on the Han king's foot, then whispered in his ear: 'Han is currently in a bad situation. How can we prohibit Xin from becoming king?

sentences.zh: 不如因而立，善遇之，使自為守。

translations.literal: It would be better to take advantage of this to establish him, treat him well, and let him guard it himself.

sentences.zh: 不然，變生。」

translations.literal: Not so, change arise.'
translations.idiomatic: Otherwise, trouble will arise.'

sentences.zh: 漢王亦悟，因復罵曰：「大丈夫定諸侯，即為真王耳，何以假為！」

translations.literal: Han wang also awaken, then again curse say: Great man settle feudal lords, then be true wang, what with temporary for!
translations.idiomatic: The Han king also came to his senses, and then cursed again: 'When a great man settles the feudal lords, he becomes a true king. Why be temporary!'

sentences.zh: 乃遣張良往立信為齊王，徵其兵擊楚。

translations.literal: He then dispatched Zhang Liang to go establish Xin as King of Qi and summoned his troops to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚已亡龍且，項王恐，使盱眙人武涉往說齊王信曰：「天下共苦秦久矣，相與力擊秦。

translations.literal: Chu already lose Long Ju, Xiang wang fear, send Xu Yi person Wu She go persuade Qi wang Xin say: World together suffer Qin long, mutually with strength strike Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Chu had already lost Long Ju. King Xiang feared this and sent Wu She from Xuyi to persuade King Xin of Qi: 'The world together suffered under Qin for a long time. We mutually used our strength to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦已破，計功割地，分土而王之，以休士卒。

translations.literal: Qin was already broken. We counted merits and divided land, apportioning territories to make kings of them, to rest the soldiers.

sentences.zh: 今漢王復興兵而東，侵人之分，奪人之地，已破三秦，引兵出關，收諸侯之兵以東擊楚，其意非盡吞天下者不休，其不知厭足如是甚也。

translations.literal: Now the Han king has again raised troops and gone east, invading others' shares and seizing others' lands. He has already broken the three Qin, led troops out of the pass, gathered the feudal lords' troops to attack Chu eastward. His intention is not to rest until he has completely swallowed the world. His lack of satisfaction is this extreme.

sentences.zh: 且漢王不可必，身居項王掌握中數矣，項王憐而活之，然得脫，輒倍約，復擊項王，其不可親信如此。

translations.literal: Moreover, the Han king cannot be relied upon. His body has been in King Xiang's grasp several times. King Xiang pitied him and let him live, but once he escaped, he broke agreements and attacked King Xiang again. He is untrustworthy in this way.

sentences.zh: 今足下雖自以與漢王為厚交，為之盡力用兵，終為之所禽矣。

translations.literal: Now although Your Lordship considers yourself to have thick friendship with the Han king and exhausts strength using troops for him, you will ultimately be captured by him.

sentences.zh: 足下所以得須臾至今者，以項王尚存也。

translations.literal: The reason Your Lordship has been able to survive until now is because King Xiang still exists.

sentences.zh: 當今二王之事，權在足下。

translations.literal: The affairs of the two kings today—the authority is in Your Lordship's hands.

sentences.zh: 足下右投則漢王勝，左投則項王勝。

translations.literal: If Your Lordship leans right then the Han king wins; if you lean left then King Xiang wins.

sentences.zh: 項王今日亡，則次取足下。

translations.literal: If King Xiang perishes today, then next they will take Your Lordship.

sentences.zh: 足下與項王有故，何不反漢與楚連和，參分天下王之？

translations.literal: Your honor with Xiang wang have old, why not rebel Han with Chu connect ally, divide three world wang it?
translations.idiomatic: Your Lordship has old ties with King Xiang. Why not rebel against Han and ally with Chu, dividing the world into three to make kings of it?

sentences.zh: 今釋此時，而自必於漢以擊楚，且為智者固若此乎！」

translations.literal: Now release this time, but self certain Han to strike Chu, moreover for wise firmly like this!'
translations.idiomatic: Now to release this opportunity and instead commit yourself to Han to attack Chu—is this truly the way of the wise!'

sentences.zh: 韓信謝曰：「臣事項王，官不過郎中，位不過執戟，言不聽，畫不用，故倍楚而歸漢。

translations.literal: Han Xin thank say: Minister serve Xiang wang, official not exceed attendant middle, position not exceed hold halberd, words not listen, plans not use, therefore double Chu return Han.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin thanked him and said: 'This minister served King Xiang. My official position did not exceed attendant-in-ordinary. My rank did not exceed halberd-holder. My words were not listened to, my plans were not used. Therefore I abandoned Chu and returned to Han.

sentences.zh: 漢王授我上將軍印，予我數萬眾，解衣衣我，推食食我，言聽計用，故吾得以至於此。

translations.literal: The Han king bestowed on me the supreme general's seal, gave me tens of thousands of troops, loosened his clothes to clothe me, pushed his food to feed me. My words were listened to, my plans were used. Therefore I have been able to reach this point.

sentences.zh: 夫人深親信我，我倍之不祥，雖死不易。

translations.literal: That person deeply and closely trusted me. For me to betray that would be inauspicious. Though I die, I will not change.

sentences.zh: 幸為信謝項王！」

translations.literal: Fortunate for Xin thank Xiang wang!'
translations.idiomatic: Please convey my thanks to King Xiang on Xin's behalf!'

sentences.zh: 武涉已去，齊人蒯通知天下權在韓信，欲為奇策而感動之，以相人說韓信曰：「仆嘗受相人之術。」

translations.literal: Wu She already go, Qi person Kuai Tong know world authority in Han Xin, wish make extraordinary plan move him, with physiognomy persuade Han Xin say: I once receive physiognomy technique.
translations.idiomatic: After Wu She had gone, the Qi man Kuai Tong knew that world authority was in Han Xin. He wished to make an extraordinary plan to move him, and persuaded Han Xin using physiognomy: 'I once received the technique of physiognomy.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「先生相人何如？」

translations.literal: Han Xin say: Mister physiognomy people how?
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'How is sir's physiognomy of people?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「貴賤在於骨法，憂喜在於容色，成敗在於決斷，以此參之，萬不失一。」

translations.literal: Reply say: Noble base in bone method, worry joy in face color, success defeat in decision, with this verify, ten thousand not miss one.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Nobility and baseness are in the bone structure. Worry and joy are in the facial color. Success and defeat are in decision-making. Verifying with this, I never miss once in ten thousand.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「善。

translations.literal: Han Xin say: Good.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'Good.

sentences.zh: 先生相寡人何如？」

translations.literal: Mister physiognomy me how?'
translations.idiomatic: How does sir physiognomy me?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「願少閒。」

translations.literal: Reply say: Wish little leisure.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'I wish a little leisure.'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「左右去矣。」

translations.literal: Xin say: Left right go.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'Those on the left and right, go away.'

sentences.zh: 通曰：「相君之面，不過封侯，又危不安。

translations.literal: Tong say: Physiognomy lord face, not exceed enfeoff marquis, moreover danger not peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: Tong said: 'Physiognomy of your lordship's face does not exceed enfeoffment as marquis, and moreover is dangerous and unpeaceful.

sentences.zh: 相君之背，貴乃不可言。」

translations.literal: Physiognomy lord back, noble then not able speak.'
translations.idiomatic: Physiognomy of your lordship's back—the nobility is unspeakable.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「何謂也？」

translations.literal: Han Xin say: What call?
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'What does this mean?'

sentences.zh: 蒯通曰：「天下初發難也，俊雄豪桀建號壹呼，天下之士雲合霧集，魚鱗襍遝，熛至風起。

translations.literal: Kuai Tong say: World initial send difficulty, outstanding male heroic outstanding establish name one call, world scholars cloud assemble mist gather, fish scale mixed crowded, flame arrive wind rise.
translations.idiomatic: Kuai Tong said: 'When the world first rose in difficulty, outstanding men and heroic leaders established names with one call. The world's scholars assembled like clouds and gathered like mist, crowded like fish scales, with flames arriving and winds rising.

sentences.zh: 當此之時，憂在亡秦而已。

translations.literal: At this time, worry was only in perishing Qin.

sentences.zh: 今楚漢分爭，使天下無罪之人肝膽涂地，父子暴骸骨於中野，不可勝數。

translations.literal: Now Chu and Han divide and contend, causing the world's innocent people to have their livers and gall smeared on the ground, fathers and sons exposing their skeleton bones in the central fields, beyond counting.

sentences.zh: 楚人起彭城，轉鬬逐北，至於滎陽，乘利席卷，威震天下。

translations.literal: The Chu people rose from Pengcheng, turned in battle and pursued northward, arriving at Xingyang. They rode advantage and rolled it up like a mat, their might shaking all under heaven.

sentences.zh: 然兵困於京、索之閒，迫西山而不能進者，三年於此矣。

translations.literal: However, troops were distressed between Jing and Suo, pressed against the western mountains and unable to advance—for three years it has been like this.

sentences.zh: 漢王將數十萬之眾，距鞏、雒，阻山河之險，一日數戰，無尺寸之功，折北不救，敗滎陽，傷成皋，遂走宛、葉之閒，此所謂智勇俱困者也。

translations.literal: The Han king leads several hundred thousand troops, resists at Gong and Luo, blocks the dangers of mountains and rivers. In one day several battles, no inch of merit. Breaking northward without rescue, defeating at Xingyang, injuring at Chenggao, then fleeing between Wan and Ye—this is what is called both wisdom and courage being distressed.

sentences.zh: 夫銳氣挫於險塞，而糧食竭於內府，百姓罷極怨望，容容無所倚。

translations.literal: Indeed, sharp energy is frustrated at dangerous barriers, and grain is exhausted in the inner storehouses. The common people are extremely weary and resentful, wandering with nothing to rely on.

sentences.zh: 以臣料之，其勢非天下之賢聖固不能息天下之禍。

translations.literal: In this minister's estimation, the situation is such that only a world-worthy sage can firmly extinguish the world's calamities.

sentences.zh: 當今兩主之命縣於足下。

translations.literal: The fate of the two lords today hangs on Your Lordship.

sentences.zh: 足下為漢則漢勝，與楚則楚勝。

translations.literal: If Your Lordship sides with Han then Han wins; if you ally with Chu then Chu wins.

sentences.zh: 臣願披腹心，輸肝膽，效愚計，恐足下不能用也。

translations.literal: This minister wishes to bare his innermost thoughts, offer his liver and gall, present his foolish plans, fearing that Your Lordship may not be able to use them.

sentences.zh: 誠能聽臣之計，莫若兩利而俱存之，參分天下，鼎足而居，其勢莫敢先動。

translations.literal: If you can sincerely listen to this minister's plan, nothing is better than benefiting both sides and preserving them together, dividing the world into three, standing as tripod feet, then no one would dare move first.

sentences.zh: 夫以足下之賢聖，有甲兵之眾，據彊齊，從燕、趙，出空虛之地而制其後，因民之欲，西鄉為百姓請命，則天下風走而響應矣，孰敢不聽！

translations.literal: Indeed with your honor worthy sage, have armored soldiers multitude, occupy strong Qi, follow Yan, Zhao, exit empty void land control their rear, follow people desire, west face for common people request fate, then world wind run respond, who dare not listen!
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, with Your Lordship's worthiness and sageliness, possessing multitudes of armored soldiers, occupying strong Qi, following Yan and Zhao, exiting from empty territory to control their rear, following the people's desires, facing west to petition for the common people, then the world would run like the wind in response—who would dare not listen!

sentences.zh: 邦大弱彊，以立諸侯，諸侯已立，天下服聽而歸德於齊。

translations.literal: Strengthen the weak and weaken the strong among the states to establish feudal lords. Once the feudal lords are established, the world will submit and listen, returning virtue to Qi.

sentences.zh: 案齊之故，有膠、泗之地，懷諸侯以德，深拱揖讓，則天下之君王相率而朝於齊矣。

translations.literal: According to Qi's former territory, possessing the lands of Jiao and Si, embracing the feudal lords with virtue, deeply bowing and yielding, then the world's lord kings would lead each other to court at Qi.

sentences.zh: 蓋聞天與弗取，反受其咎；

translations.literal: Cover hear heaven give not take, instead receive its blame;
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that when heaven gives and you do not take, you instead receive its blame;

sentences.zh: 時至不行，反受其殃。

translations.literal: When the time arrives and you do not act, you instead receive its calamity.

sentences.zh: 願足下孰慮之。」

translations.literal: Wish your honor carefully consider.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Lordship to carefully consider this.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「漢王遇我甚厚，載我以其車，衣我以其衣，食我以其食。

translations.literal: Han Xin say: Han wang treat me very thick, load me with his chariot, clothe me with his clothes, feed me with his food.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'The Han king has treated me very generously, loading me with his chariot, clothing me with his clothes, feeding me with his food.

sentences.zh: 吾聞之，乘人之車者載人之患，衣人之衣者懷人之憂，食人之食者死人之事，吾豈可以鄉利倍義乎！」

translations.literal: I hear, ride people chariot load people trouble, wear people clothes harbor people worry, eat people food die people affairs, I how can face profit double righteousness!'
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that one who rides another's chariot bears another's troubles; one who wears another's clothes harbors another's worries; one who eats another's food dies for another's affairs. How can I face profit and double-cross righteousness!'

sentences.zh: 蒯生曰：「足下自以為善漢王，欲建萬世之業，臣竊以為誤矣。

translations.literal: Kuai Sheng say: Your honor self think good Han wang, wish build ten thousand generations enterprise, minister secretly think wrong.
translations.idiomatic: Kuai Sheng said: 'Your Lordship considers himself good to the Han king, wishing to build an enterprise for ten thousand generations. This minister secretly thinks you are mistaken.

sentences.zh: 始常山王、成安君為布衣時，相與為刎頸之交，後爭張黶、陳澤之事，二人相怨。

translations.literal: When the King of Changshan and Lord Cheng'an were commoners, they were friends who would die for each other. Later they contended over the affairs of Zhang Er and Chen Ze, and the two resented each other.

sentences.zh: 常山王背項王，奉項嬰頭而竄，逃歸於漢王。

translations.literal: The King of Changshan betrayed King Xiang, presented Xiang Ying's head and fled, escaping to return to the Han king.

sentences.zh: 漢王借兵而東下，殺成安君泜水之南，頭足異處，卒為天下笑。

translations.literal: The Han king borrowed troops and went east, killing Lord Cheng'an south of the Chi River, separating head from feet, finally becoming a laughingstock to the world.

sentences.zh: 此二人相與，天下至驩也。

translations.literal: These two were as close as any in the world.

sentences.zh: 然而卒相禽者，何也？

translations.literal: However finally mutually capture, what?
translations.idiomatic: However, in the end they captured each other. Why was this?

sentences.zh: 患生於多欲而人心難測也。

translations.literal: Trouble arose from many desires, but the human heart is difficult to measure.

sentences.zh: 今足下欲行忠信以交於漢王，必不能固於二君之相與也，而事多大於張黶、陳澤。

translations.literal: Now Your Lordship wishes to practice loyalty and trust to befriend the Han king. You certainly cannot be as firm as the friendship between those two lords, and the affairs are much greater than those of Zhang Er and Chen Ze.

sentences.zh: 故臣以為足下必漢王之不危己，亦誤矣。

translations.literal: Therefore this minister thinks that Your Lordship being certain the Han king will not endanger you is also mistaken.

sentences.zh: 大夫種、范蠡存亡越，霸句踐，立功成名而身死亡。

translations.literal: Grand Master Zhong and Fan Li preserved the perishing Yue, made Gou Jian hegemon, established merit and completed their names, but their bodies died and fled.

sentences.zh: 野獸已盡而獵狗亨。

translations.literal: When the wild beasts are exhausted, the hunting dogs are cooked.

sentences.zh: 夫以交友言之，則不如張耳之與成安君者也；

translations.literal: Indeed with make friends speak, then not as Zhang Er with Cheng An jun;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, speaking of making friends, it is not as good as Zhang Er's friendship with Lord Cheng'an;

sentences.zh: 以忠信言之，則不過大夫種、范蠡之於句踐也。

translations.literal: Speaking of loyalty and trust, it does not exceed Grand Master Zhong and Fan Li's service to Gou Jian.

sentences.zh: 此二人者，足以觀矣。

translations.literal: These two men are sufficient to observe.

sentences.zh: 願足下深慮之。

translations.literal: I wish Your Lordship to deeply consider this.

sentences.zh: 且臣聞勇略震主者身危，而功蓋天下者不賞。

translations.literal: Moreover, this minister has heard that one whose bravery and strategy shake his lord is in danger of his life, and one whose merit covers the world is not rewarded.

sentences.zh: 臣請言大王功略：足下涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，引兵下井陘，誅成安君，徇趙，脅燕，定齊，南摧楚人之兵二十萬，東殺龍且，西鄉以報，此所謂功無二於天下，而略不世出者也。

translations.literal: Minister please speak great wang merit strategy: Your honor ford Xi He, capture Wei wang, catch Xia Yue, lead troops descend Jing Xing, execute Cheng An jun, follow Zhao, threaten Yan, settle Qi, south smash Chu people troops twenty ten thousand, east kill Long Ju, west face report, this called merit no two in world, but strategy not generation out.
translations.idiomatic: This minister will speak of the great king's merits and strategies: Your Lordship forded the Xi River, captured the King of Wei, caught Xia Yue, led troops down Jingxing, executed Lord Cheng'an, followed Zhao, threatened Yan, settled Qi, south smashed Chu's twenty thousand troops, east killed Long Ju, west faced to report—this is called merit unmatched in the world, and strategy that does not appear in a generation.

sentences.zh: 今足下戴震主之威，挾不賞之功，歸楚，楚人不信；

translations.literal: Now your honor wear shake lord might, grip not reward merit, return Chu, Chu people not trust;
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Lordship bears the might that shakes your lord, grips merit that will not be rewarded. If you return to Chu, Chu people will not trust you;

sentences.zh: 歸漢，漢人震恐：足下欲持是安歸乎？

translations.literal: Return Han, Han people shake fear: Your honor wish hold this where return?
translations.idiomatic: If you return to Han, Han people will shake with fear: Where does Your Lordship wish to hold this and return?

sentences.zh: 夫勢在人臣之位而有震主之威，名高天下，竊為足下危之。」

translations.literal: Indeed situation in person minister position but have shake lord might, name high world, secretly for your honor danger.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, the situation of being in a minister's position but having might that shakes your lord, with a name higher than the world—I secretly fear danger for Your Lordship.'

sentences.zh: 韓信謝曰：「先生且休矣，吾將念之。」

translations.literal: Han Xin thank say: Mister temporarily rest, I will think it.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin thanked him and said: 'Sir, rest for now. I will think about it.'

sentences.zh: 後數日，蒯通復說曰：「夫聽者事之候也，計者事之機也，聽過計失而能久安者，鮮矣。

translations.literal: Later several days, Kuai Tong again persuade say: Indeed listen affair wait, plan affair mechanism, listen wrong plan lose but able long peaceful, few.
translations.idiomatic: After several days, Kuai Tong again persuaded, saying: 'Indeed, listening is the sign of affairs, planning is the mechanism of affairs. Those who listen wrongly and plan poorly yet can remain peaceful for long are few.

sentences.zh: 聽不失一二者，不可亂以言；

translations.literal: Listen not miss one two, not able confuse with words;
translations.idiomatic: One who does not miss once or twice in listening cannot be confused with words;

sentences.zh: 計不失本末者，不可紛以辭。

translations.literal: One who does not miss root or end in planning cannot be confused with speech.

sentences.zh: 夫隨廝養之役者，失萬乘之權；

translations.literal: Indeed follow lackey raise service, lose ten thousand chariots authority;
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, one who follows the service of lackeys and attendants loses the authority of ten thousand chariots;

sentences.zh: 守儋石之祿者，闕卿相之位。

translations.literal: One who guards the salary of dan and stone lacks the position of minister and chancellor.

sentences.zh: 故知者決之斷也，疑者事之害也，審豪氂之小計，遺天下之大數，智誠知之，決弗敢行者，百事之禍也。

translations.literal: Therefore, the wise decide with decisiveness, the doubtful harm affairs. Examining the small plans of fine hairs, abandoning the great numbers of the world—even if wisdom sincerely knows, but decides not to dare act—this is the calamity of a hundred affairs.

sentences.zh: 故曰『猛虎之猶豫，不若蜂蠆之致螫；

translations.literal: Therefore say fierce tiger hesitate, not as bee scorpion deliver sting;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: 'A fierce tiger's hesitation is not as good as a bee or scorpion's delivered sting;

sentences.zh: 騏驥之跼躅，不如駑馬之安步；

translations.literal: Qi Ji hesitate, not as inferior horse peaceful step;
translations.idiomatic: A Qiji's hesitation is not as good as an inferior horse's peaceful steps;

sentences.zh: 孟賁之狐疑，不如庸夫之必至也；

translations.literal: Meng Ben fox doubt, not as ordinary man certain arrive;
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ben's fox-like doubt is not as good as an ordinary man's certain arrival;

sentences.zh: 雖有舜禹之智，吟而不言，不如瘖聾之指麾也』。

translations.literal: Though have Shun Yu wisdom, chant not speak, not as mute deaf point command.'
translations.idiomatic: Though one has the wisdom of Shun and Yu, chanting without speaking, it is not as good as a mute or deaf person's pointing and commanding.'

sentences.zh: 此言貴能行之。

translations.literal: These words value the ability to act.

sentences.zh: 夫功者難成而易敗，時者難得而易失也。

translations.literal: Indeed, merit is difficult to complete but easy to defeat; time is difficult to obtain but easy to lose.

sentences.zh: 時乎時，不再來。

translations.literal: Time, oh time, does not come again.

sentences.zh: 願足下詳察之。」

translations.literal: Wish your honor detailed examine.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish Your Lordship to examine it in detail.'

sentences.zh: 韓信猶豫不忍倍漢，又自以為功多，漢終不奪我齊，遂謝蒯通。

translations.literal: Han Xin hesitated and could not bear to betray Han. Moreover, he thought his merits were many, and Han would ultimately not seize his Qi. He then thanked Kuai Tong.

sentences.zh: 蒯通說不聽，已詳狂為巫。

translations.literal: Kuai Tong's persuasion was not listened to, so he pretended madness and became a shaman.

sentences.zh: 漢王之困固陵，用張良計，召齊王信，遂將兵會垓下。

translations.literal: When the Han king was distressed at Guling, he used Zhang Liang's plan and summoned King Xin of Qi. Xin then led troops to assemble at Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 項羽已破，高祖襲奪齊王軍。

translations.literal: After Xiang Yu was broken, Gaozu attacked and seized the army of the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 漢五年正月，徙齊王信為楚王，都下邳。

translations.literal: In the first month of the fifth year of Han, King Xin of Qi was moved to become King of Chu, with his capital at Xiapi.

sentences.zh: 信至國，召所從食漂母，賜千金。

translations.literal: When Xin arrived in his state, he summoned the washerwoman who had fed him, and granted her a thousand pieces of gold.

sentences.zh: 及下鄉南昌亭長，賜百錢，曰：「公，小人也，為德不卒。」

translations.literal: Reach Xia Xiang Nan Chang pavilion chief, grant hundred cash, say: Sir, small person, make virtue not complete.
translations.idiomatic: He also reached the pavilion chief of Xiaxiang in Nanchang, granting him a hundred cash, saying: 'Sir, you are a petty man who did not complete your virtue.'

sentences.zh: 召辱己之少年令出胯下者以為楚中尉。

translations.literal: He summoned the youth who had humiliated him by making him crawl between his legs, appointing him as Central Captain of Chu.

sentences.zh: 告諸將相曰：「此壯士也。

translations.literal: Tell various generals ministers say: This strong warrior.
translations.idiomatic: He told the various generals and ministers: 'This is a strong warrior.

sentences.zh: 方辱我時，我寧不能殺之邪？

translations.literal: Just humiliate me time, I rather not able kill him?
translations.idiomatic: When he was humiliating me, could I not have killed him?

sentences.zh: 殺之無名，故忍而就於此。」

translations.literal: Kill him without name, therefore endure and come to this.'
translations.idiomatic: To kill him would have been without justification, therefore I endured and came to this.'

sentences.zh: 項王亡將鐘離眛家在伊廬，素與信善。

translations.literal: The fleeing general of King Xiang, Zhongli Mo, had his home in Yilu and was on good terms with Xin.

sentences.zh: 項王死後，亡歸信。

translations.literal: After King Xiang died, Zhongli Mo fled and returned to Xin.

sentences.zh: 漢王怨眛，聞其在楚，詔楚捕眛。

translations.literal: The Han king resented Mo. Hearing that he was in Chu, he decreed that Chu capture Mo.

sentences.zh: 信初之國，行縣邑，陳兵出入。

translations.literal: When Xin first went to his state, he traveled through the counties and towns, arraying troops for his exits and entries.

sentences.zh: 漢六年，人有上書告楚王信反。

translations.literal: In the sixth year of Han, someone submitted a memorial accusing King Xin of Chu of rebellion.

sentences.zh: 高帝以陳平計，天子巡狩會諸侯，南方有雲夢，發使告諸侯會陳：「吾將游雲夢。」

translations.literal: Gao Di with Chen Ping plan, Son of Heaven tour hunt assemble various marquises, south have Yun Meng, send envoy tell various marquises assemble Chen: I will tour Yun Meng.
translations.idiomatic: The Gao Emperor, following Chen Ping's plan, had the Son of Heaven tour and hunt while assembling the various lords. There was Yunmeng to the south, and he sent envoys to tell the various lords to assemble at Chen: 'I will tour Yunmeng.'

sentences.zh: 實欲襲信，信弗知。

translations.literal: In truth he wished to attack Xin, but Xin did not know.

sentences.zh: 高祖且至楚，信欲發兵反，自度無罪，欲謁上，恐見禽。

translations.literal: As Gaozu was about to arrive in Chu, Xin wished to send troops in rebellion, but measured himself without crime. He wished to meet the sovereign but feared being captured.

sentences.zh: 人或說信曰：「斬眛謁上，上必喜，無患。」

translations.literal: Person or persuade Xin say: Behead Mo meet sovereign, sovereign must happy, no trouble.
translations.idiomatic: Someone persuaded Xin, saying: 'Behead Mo and meet the sovereign. The sovereign will certainly be happy, and there will be no trouble.'

sentences.zh: 信見眛計事。

translations.literal: Xin consulted with Mo about the matter.

sentences.zh: 眛曰：「漢所以不擊取楚，以眛在公所。

translations.literal: Mo say: Han reason not strike take Chu, because Mo in your excellency place.
translations.idiomatic: Mo said: 'The reason Han does not strike and take Chu is because Mo is with Your Lordship.

sentences.zh: 若欲捕我以自媚於漢，吾今日死，公亦隨手亡矣。」

translations.literal: If wish capture me to self flatter at Han, I today die, your excellency also follow hand perish.'
translations.idiomatic: If you wish to capture me to flatter yourself to Han, I will die today, and Your Lordship will also perish immediately.'

sentences.zh: 乃罵信曰：「公非長者！」

translations.literal: Then curse Xin say: Your excellency not elder!
translations.idiomatic: He then cursed Xin, saying: 'Your Lordship is not a gentleman!'

sentences.zh: 卒自剄。

translations.literal: Finally he slit his own throat.

sentences.zh: 信持其首，謁高祖於陳。

translations.literal: Xin held his head and met Gaozu at Chen.

sentences.zh: 上令武士縛信，載後車。

translations.literal: The sovereign ordered the warriors to bind Xin and load him into the rear chariot.

sentences.zh: 信曰：「果若人言，『狡兔死，良狗亨；

translations.literal: Xin say: Indeed as people say, crafty rabbit die, good dog cook;
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'Indeed as people say: "When the crafty rabbit dies, the good dog is cooked;"

sentences.zh: 高鳥盡，良弓藏；

translations.literal: High bird exhaust, good bow hide;
translations.idiomatic: When the high-flying birds are exhausted, the good bow is stored away;

sentences.zh: 敵國破，謀臣亡。』

translations.literal: Enemy state broken, plot minister perish.'
translations.idiomatic: When enemy states are broken, the plotting ministers perish.'

sentences.zh: 天下已定，我固當亨！」

translations.literal: World already settled, I firmly should cook!'
translations.idiomatic: The world is now settled, and I should indeed be cooked!'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「人告公反。」

translations.literal: Sovereign say: Person accuse your excellency rebel.
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign said: 'Someone accused Your Lordship of rebellion.'

sentences.zh: 遂械系信。

translations.literal: He then had Xin shackled and bound.

sentences.zh: 至雒陽，赦信罪，以為淮陰侯。

translations.literal: When they arrived at Luoyang, he pardoned Xin's crime and made him Marquis of Huaiyin.

sentences.zh: 信知漢王畏惡其能，常稱病不朝從。

translations.literal: Xin knew the Han king feared and hated his abilities, so he often claimed illness and did not attend court.

sentences.zh: 信由此日夜怨望，居常鞅鞅，羞與絳、灌等列。

translations.literal: From this Xin resented day and night, always lived in agitation, ashamed to be ranked with Jiang and Guan and the like.

sentences.zh: 信嘗過樊將軍噲，噲跪拜送迎，言稱臣，曰：「大王乃肯臨臣！」

translations.literal: Xin once pass Fan general Kuai, Kuai kneel bow send welcome, words call minister, say: Great wang then willing descend minister!
translations.idiomatic: Once when Xin passed by General Fan Kuai, Kuai knelt and bowed to send him off and welcome him, addressing him as minister, saying: 'The Great King finally deigns to visit this minister!'

sentences.zh: 信出門，笑曰：「生乃與噲等為伍！」

translations.literal: Xin exit door, laugh say: Live then with Kuai equal as company!
translations.idiomatic: When Xin exited the door, he laughed and said: 'I am alive and yet have to be in the same company as Kuai and his like!'

sentences.zh: 上常從容與信言諸將能不，各有差。

translations.literal: The sovereign often leisurely spoke with Xin about whether the various generals had ability, each having their differences.

sentences.zh: 上問曰：「如我能將幾何？」

translations.literal: Sovereign ask say: Like me able lead how many?
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign asked: 'How many could I lead like me?'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「陛下不過能將十萬。」

translations.literal: Xin say: Your majesty not exceed able lead ten ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'Your Majesty can lead no more than a hundred thousand.'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「於君何如？」

translations.literal: Sovereign say: To minister what like?
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign said: 'What about you?'

sentences.zh: 曰：「臣多多而益善耳。」

translations.literal: Say: Minister many many but benefit good only.
