translations.idiomatic: He said: 'For this minister, the more the better.'

sentences.zh: 上笑曰：「多多益善，何為為我禽？」

translations.literal: Sovereign laugh say: Many many benefit good, why be for me capture?
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign laughed and said: 'The more the better, so why were you captured by me?'

sentences.zh: 信曰：「陛下不能將兵，而善將將，此乃言之所以為陛下禽也。

translations.literal: Xin say: Your majesty not able lead troops, but good lead leaders, this then speak reason be for your majesty capture.
translations.idiomatic: Xin said: 'Your Majesty cannot lead troops, but is good at leading leaders. This is the reason why the words were captured for Your Majesty.

sentences.zh: 且陛下所謂天授，非人力也。」

translations.literal: Moreover your majesty called heaven bestow, not human strength.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, what Your Majesty calls heaven's gift is not human strength.'

sentences.zh: 陳豨拜為鉅鹿守，辭於淮陰侯。

translations.literal: Chen Xi was appointed as guard of Julu and took leave of the Marquis of Huaiyin.

sentences.zh: 淮陰侯挈其手，辟左右與之步於庭，仰天嘆曰：「子可與言乎？

translations.literal: Huai Yin marquis lead his hand, avoid left right with him walk at courtyard, face heaven sigh say: You can with speak?
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Huaiyin took his hand, dismissed his attendants, and walked with him in the courtyard. He faced heaven and sighed, saying: 'Can I speak with you?

sentences.zh: 欲與子有言也。」

translations.literal: Wish with you have words.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish to have words with you.'

sentences.zh: 豨曰：「唯將軍令之。」

translations.literal: Xi say: Only general order.
translations.idiomatic: Xi said: 'Only as the general orders.'

sentences.zh: 淮陰侯曰：「公之所居，天下精兵處也；

translations.literal: Huai Yin marquis say: Your excellency place reside, world elite troops place;
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Huaiyin said: 'Where Your Lordship resides is where the world's elite troops are stationed;

sentences.zh: 而公，陛下之信幸臣也。

translations.literal: and Your Lordship is His Majesty's trusted and favored minister.

sentences.zh: 人言公之畔，陛下必不信；

translations.literal: Person speak your excellency rebel, your majesty must not believe;
translations.idiomatic: If people speak of Your Lordship rebelling, His Majesty certainly will not believe it;

sentences.zh: 再至，陛下乃疑矣；

translations.literal: Again arrive, your majesty then doubt;
translations.idiomatic: If you come a second time, His Majesty will become suspicious;

sentences.zh: 三至，必怒而自將。

translations.literal: A third time, he will certainly become angry and lead the troops himself.

sentences.zh: 吾為公從中起，天下可圖也。」

translations.literal: I for your excellency from middle arise, world can plot.'
translations.idiomatic: I will rise up from within to help Your Lordship, and the world can be taken.'

sentences.zh: 陳豨素知其能也，信之，曰：「謹奉教！」

translations.literal: Chen Xi always know his ability, believe him, say: Respectfully receive teaching!
translations.idiomatic: Chen Xi had long known his abilities, believed him, and said: 'I respectfully accept your teachings!'

sentences.zh: 漢十年，陳豨果反。

translations.literal: In the tenth year of Han, Chen Xi indeed rebelled.

sentences.zh: 上自將而往，信病不從。

translations.literal: The sovereign led the troops himself and went, but Xin claimed illness and did not follow.

sentences.zh: 陰使人至豨所，曰：「弟舉兵，吾從此助公。」

translations.literal: Secret send person arrive Xi place, say: Younger brother raise troops, I from this help your excellency.
translations.idiomatic: Secretly he sent someone to Xi's location, saying: 'Little brother is raising troops, I will help you from here.'

sentences.zh: 信乃謀與家臣夜詐詔赦諸官徒奴，欲發以襲呂后、太子。

translations.literal: Xin then plotted with his household ministers to forge a decree at night pardoning various official convicts and slaves, intending to dispatch them to attack Empress Lu and the Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 部署已定，待豨報。

translations.literal: The deployment was already arranged, waiting for Xi's report.

sentences.zh: 其舍人得罪於信，信囚，欲殺之。

translations.literal: His retainer had offended Xin, so Xin imprisoned him and wished to kill him.

sentences.zh: 舍人弟上變，告信欲反狀於呂后。

translations.literal: The retainer's younger brother reported the change and accused Xin of plotting rebellion to Empress Lu.

sentences.zh: 呂后欲召，恐其黨不就，乃與蕭相國謀，詐令人從上所來，言豨已得死，列侯群臣皆賀。

translations.literal: Empress Lu wished to summon him but feared his partisans would not come, so she plotted with Prime Minister Xiao to have someone falsely come from the sovereign's location, saying Xi had already been captured and executed, and all the feudal marquises and ministers were congratulating.

sentences.zh: 相國紿信曰：「雖疾，彊入賀。」

translations.literal: Prime minister deceive Xin say: Though ill, strong enter congratulate.
translations.idiomatic: The prime minister deceived Xin, saying: 'Though ill, force yourself to enter and congratulate.'

sentences.zh: 信入，呂后使武士縛信，斬之長樂鐘室。

translations.literal: When Xin entered, Empress Lu had the warriors bind him and behead him in the Chang Le bell chamber.

sentences.zh: 信方斬，曰：「吾悔不用蒯通之計，乃為兒女子所詐，豈非天哉！」

translations.literal: Xin just behead, say: I regret not use Kuai Tong plan, then be children women deceive, how not heaven!
translations.idiomatic: As Xin was about to be beheaded, he said: 'I regret not using Kuai Tong's plan, only to be deceived by women and children. Is this not heaven's doing!'

sentences.zh: 遂夷信三族。

translations.literal: He then exterminated Xin's three clans.

sentences.zh: 高祖已從豨軍來，至，見信死，且喜且憐之，問：「信死亦何言？」

translations.literal: Gao Zu already from Xi army come, arrive, see Xin dead, and happy and pity him, ask: Xin die also what speak?
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu had already returned from the Xi campaign and arrived. Seeing Xin dead, he was both happy and pitying, and asked: 'What did Xin say when he died?'

sentences.zh: 呂后曰：「信言恨不用蒯通計。」

translations.literal: Empress Lu say: Xin speak regret not use Kuai Tong plan.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lu said: 'Xin said he regretted not using Kuai Tong's plan.'

sentences.zh: 高祖曰：「是齊辯士也。」

translations.literal: Gao Zu say: This Qi eloquent scholar.
translations.idiomatic: Gaozu said: 'This is Qi's eloquent scholar.'

sentences.zh: 乃詔齊捕蒯通。

translations.literal: He then decreed that Qi capture Kuai Tong.

sentences.zh: 蒯通至，上曰：「若教淮陰侯反乎？」

translations.literal: Kuai Tong arrive, sovereign say: You teach Huai Yin marquis rebel?
translations.idiomatic: When Kuai Tong arrived, the sovereign said: 'Did you teach the Marquis of Huaiyin to rebel?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「然，臣固教之。

translations.literal: Reply say: Yes, minister indeed teach him.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Yes, this minister indeed taught him.

sentences.zh: 豎子不用臣之策，故令自夷於此。

translations.literal: That little child did not use this minister's strategy, therefore causing himself to be exterminated here.

sentences.zh: 如彼豎子用臣之計，陛下安得而夷之乎！」

translations.literal: Like that little child use minister plan, your majesty how obtain and exterminate him!'
translations.idiomatic: If that little child had used this minister's plan, how would Your Majesty have been able to exterminate him!'

sentences.zh: 上怒曰：「亨之。」

translations.literal: Sovereign angry say: Cook him.
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign angrily said: 'Cook him.'

sentences.zh: 通曰：「嗟乎，冤哉亨也！」

translations.literal: Tong say: Alas, wronged cook!
translations.idiomatic: Tong said: 'Alas, what a wrongful cooking!'

sentences.zh: 上曰：「若教韓信反，何冤？」

translations.literal: Sovereign say: You teach Han Xin rebel, what wronged?
translations.idiomatic: The sovereign said: 'You taught Han Xin to rebel, how is that wronged?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「秦之綱絕而維弛，山東大擾，異姓并起，英俊烏集。

translations.literal: Reply say: Qin net break and cord loose, east of mountains great disturb, different surname together rise, outstanding talents raven gather.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Qin's nets were broken and cords loosened, east of the mountains was greatly disturbed, those of different surnames rose together, outstanding talents gathered like ravens.

sentences.zh: 秦失其鹿，天下共逐之，於是高材疾足者先得焉。

translations.literal: Qin lost its deer, and the world pursued it together. Thus those with high talent and fast feet obtained it first.

sentences.zh: 蹠之狗吠堯，堯非不仁，狗因吠非其主。

translations.literal: Zhi's dog barked at Yao, but Yao was not unkind—the dog merely barked at one who was not its master.

sentences.zh: 當是時，臣唯獨知韓信，非知陛下也。

translations.literal: At that time, this minister only knew Han Xin, not Your Majesty.

sentences.zh: 且天下銳精持鋒欲為陛下所為者甚眾，顧力不能耳。

translations.literal: Moreover, those throughout the world with sharp essence and holding blades who wished to do what Your Majesty did were many, but their strength was not sufficient.

sentences.zh: 又可盡亨之邪？」

translations.literal: Again can exhaust cook them?
translations.idiomatic: Could you cook them all?'

sentences.zh: 高帝曰：「置之。」

translations.literal: Gao Di say: Release him.
translations.idiomatic: The Gao Emperor said: 'Release him.'

sentences.zh: 乃釋通之罪。

translations.literal: He then released Tong from his crime.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：吾如淮陰，淮陰人為余言，韓信雖為布衣時，其志與眾異。

translations.literal: Grand historian say: I go to Huai Yin, Huai Yin people for me speak, Han Xin though be common cloth time, his ambition with crowd different.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: I went to Huaiyin, and the people of Huaiyin told me that Han Xin, even when he was a commoner, had ambitions different from the crowd.

sentences.zh: 其母死，貧無以葬，然乃行營高敞地，令其旁可置萬家。

translations.literal: When his mother died, he was poor and had no means to bury her, yet he went and chose a high and spacious site for her grave, so that beside it ten thousand families could be placed.

sentences.zh: 余視其母冢，良然。

translations.literal: I viewed his mother's tomb, and it was truly so.

sentences.zh: 假令韓信學道謙讓，不伐己功，不矜其能，則庶幾哉，於漢家勳可以比周、召、太公之徒，後世血食矣。

translations.literal: If Han Xin had studied the way of modesty and yielding, not boasting of his own merits, not being proud of his abilities, then he would almost have been able. For the Han house's merits he could have been compared to the likes of the Duke of Zhou, Duke Zhao, and the Grand Duke, and his descendants would have enjoyed sacrifices for generations.

sentences.zh: 不務出此，而天下已集，乃謀畔逆，夷滅宗族，不亦宜乎！

translations.literal: Not strive exceed this, but world already unite, then plot rebel defy, exterminate clan family, not also proper!
translations.idiomatic: He did not strive to surpass this, but when the world was already united, he plotted rebellion and defiance, his clan and family exterminated—was this not proper!
